text: I remember crying a lot.
Who wouldn't cry?

Your child goes out to work
and doesn't come home.

And then, instead of being
supported by your country,

they started accusing
him of being
associated with the attacks.
It was just not fair.
Just not right.

He actually went to
work in Manhattan,
and he worked Uptown.

And he did not come
home that day.

And we tried to locate him, and
they told [? us ?] from

his office that he never
reported to his job.

And he had forgotten his cell
phone at the job on Monday

evening, so there was no way for
him to call back home to

call his dad, who was
home at that time.
It was in him to help people.

So we knew he would have gone
down to help over there.

Even from childhood, he was very
kind and compassionate.

He brought home a sick bird
once, and the bird died, and I

threw the bird out
in the trash can.

And when he came home, he
says, where's the bird?
I said, well, the bird died.
So what did you do with it?
Threw it away.
He was so upset at me.

He went and took the bird out
and he buried him in the

backyard, and said, don't
you ever do that again.
It wasn't a missing flyer.

It was a wanted flyer, and it
said, contact the terrorist
task force.

And it said, chemistry
major, has police ID.

Why would your country
do that to you?

My hope was always there that
hopefully, he's detained.

Even if he's detained, he's
alive versus being dead.
Well, I definitely was angry.

I was angry at the injustice
that was done to my child by
my country.
And my husband--
he just lost it.

He never came back, and he
died two years later.

And that's when I started
speaking up against all the

injustices being done
in the name of 9/11.

Because what 9/11 did, it
decimated the image of Islam.

Well, he invited a few 9/11
victims' families after

bringing Osama bin
Laden to justice.

When he came up to me, he
extended his hand, and he
asked me, who did you lose?
And I said, I lost my son.
I was wearing his pin.

And he said, tell
me about him.

So I told him whatever I could
about Salman, about what a
proud American he was.
He was a Star Wars fan.

And of course, you break down
when you talk about your child

that you have lost. And I said,
if Salman were here, he
would be so happy.

I can't believe I'm
talking to you.

And after that day, I am
a different person.

My grief, my pain, my sorrows,
they just disappeared.
And I am a prouder American.
I am a prouder American.
